com.joliciel.talismane.corpus

Class CorpusLineReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.corpus.CorpusLineReader

  • public class CorpusLineReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A corpus reader that expects one token per line, and analyses the line content based on a regex supplied during construction.

    The regex contains placeholders, indicated by %, the name of a CorpusLine.CorpusElement, and another %. For example: %TOKEN% for the CorpusLine.CorpusElement.TOKEN.

    Inside this regex, the placeholders will be replaced by CorpusLine.CorpusElement.getReplacement(), prior to applying the regex to each line read.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Constructor Detail

      • CorpusLineReader

        public CorpusLineReader(java.lang.String regex,
                        CorpusLine.CorpusElement[] requiredElements,
                        java.util.List<CorpusRule> corpusRules,
                        LexicalEntryReader lexicalEntryReader,
                        TalismaneSession session)
                 throws TalismaneException
        Parameters:
        regex - the regex used to read lines, including placeholders as described in the class description
        requiredElements - any elements whose placeholders have to be found in the regex
        lexicalEntryReader - an optional lexical entry reader, for constructing a lexical entry out of each line
        session - the Talismane session
        Throws:
        TalismaneException - if the regex is missing a required placeholder

                       int lineNumber)
                throws TalismaneException
        Read one line out of the corpus, and transform it into a CorpusLine
        Parameters:
        line - the line to read
        lineNumber - the line number we reached, starting at 1.
        Throws:
        TalismaneException - if the regex wasn't matched on a given line
